doc.previous: In the 11th and 12th centuries constant incursions by nomadic Turkic tribes such as the Kipchaks and the Pechenegs caused a massive migration of Slavic populations to the safer heavily forested regions of the north particularly to the area known as Zalesye 44
doc.after: The age of feudalism and decentralization was marked by constant in fighting between members of the Rurik Dynasty that ruled Kievan Rus collectively Kiev s dominance waned to the benefit of Vladimir Suzdal in the north east Novgorod Republic in the north west and Galicia Volhynia in the south west
